result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture - Mailed to: 6802 South Reserve Road, Stone Lake, Wi  54876
Uploaded warrant document to ShareFile and sent paper copy to Sheriff's Department.  No warrant card generated.

9:36 AM Defendant Thomas Charles Quaderer not in court.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. State requests warrant and bail forfeiture proceedings.   Court grants request.  Warrant authorized (Sawyer and Surrounding Counties) as requested and bail forfeiture to begin.
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Poss w/intent to deliver
Poss of drug para
Bail/bond hearing on August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:19 AM DEF Thomas Charles Quaderer in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Pollak (special appearance).  Kenneth Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE does not qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak argues bond.  Court sets bond.   Court gives the DE the attorney colloquy. Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for September 20, 2022 at 8:30AM.  

CBS $200    ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
